com.goodworkalan.ilk
Class Ilk.Box

java.lang.Object
  com.goodworkalan.ilk.Ilk.Box
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Enclosing class:
Ilk<T>
public static final class Ilk.Box
extends Object
implements Serializable

A type-safe heterogeneous container for a single object that preserves type information and safely casts a generic object back to its generic type.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Ilk.Box

public Ilk.Box(Class<?> unboxedClass)
Create a box that contains the given class and a key that represents the given class with the class as the actual type.

I was able to create these before using reflection, but when I added the wildcard boundary to the class constructor on ilk, it became impossible to create through reflection. There was no way create anything except the unbounded wildcard class.

Method Detail

cast

public <C> C cast(Class<C> castClass)
Cast the given object to the given class.

Type Parameters:
C - The type to cast to.
Parameters:
castClass - The class to cast to.
Returns:
The contained object cast to the class.
Throws:
ClassCastException - If the object is not of the given type.

cast

public <C> C cast(Ilk<C> ilk)
Cast the given object to the given class.

This method generate the only unchecked cast warning in all of the Ilk classes. Because we first check the assignability of the key in the given ilk against the key property of this Ilk.Box, we know that the unchecked cast is actually safe, so we can suppress the unchecked warning.

Type Parameters:
C - The type to cast to.
Parameters:
ilk - The super type token of the type to cast to.
Returns:
The contained object cast to the type.
Throws:
ClassCastException - If the object is not of the given type.
